alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 5:45PM EDT until July 05 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Delaware County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Southwestern Philadelphia County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 915 PM EDT. * At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Gloucester City, Yeadon, Paulsboro, National Park, East Lansdowne, South Philadelphia, Philadelphia International Airport, Darby Township, Tinicum Township, and Darby. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 11 and 21. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 344 and 351. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
